keyDialogue.quote: I might have five minutes. We hear the WHRRRRR of POWER TOOLS going to work on his door. These people are determined. Professional. And prepared. EDDIE I'll never know how they got past security in a half-billion dollar building.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE MORGAN,, THE ADJOINING TERRACE, EDDIE (V.0.), EDDIE (V.O.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.O.), EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: They've become sophisticated. Before they couldn't have done this. But now...? The CAMERA RISES, breathlessly, in a blur, up all 80 floors of this stunning new building, coming to rest on...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: 30's, lean and stylish, standing on the exterior ledge of his multimillion-dollar terrace. New York City looms around him, beneath him. His hands are outstretched. Balancing. He is calm, but fatalistic. He's clearly going to jump.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE MORGAN,

keyDialogue.quote: I will never let them touch me. His attention is CAUGHT by the SOUNDS of a commotion in the next apartment. He looks over, at- 2.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

scenes.title: EXT. NEW YORK CITY STREET - DAY

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Not so long ago, this was me. Eddie is walking down the street, messily eating a street falafel. His hair is longer, his clothes schlumpier, his face rounder --he's out of shape. A belly bulges against his belt. He wears jeans and that worn-out corduroy "writer's" sport coat --the one that your girlfriend fights to give to the Salvation Army.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: I was a writer. Two years after my copywriting job at Dexter & Kerr came to a non-mutual end, I had, in an extraordinary burst of desperate energy, bullshitted my way into my first book contract. This was it:
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

keyDialogue.quote: Now, at last, I was ready to write. QUICK CUTS: --Eddie sprawled on the couch, eating takeout and watching TV, the sink in the foreground full of dishes. -- Eddie shooting baskets into a toy hoop.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Gearing up, that's all. --Eddie sleeping in his bed, sacked out, the clock beside him clicking to 11:59 a.m.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: Getting psyched. --Eddie sitting on the john, playing a game on his childhood Game Boy.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

keyDialogue.quote: Just like that. She shoots him a look of almost intolerable sympathy.

keyDialogue.quote: I was kind of under the impression you cared a little more than just--

keyDialogue.quote: I have to get back.
keyDialogue.speaker: LINDY

keyDialogue.quote: --Hey, well -- wait -- you didn't tell me what happened yesterday. We can see on Lindy's face that she's still vulnerably pleased that Eddie remembered to ask.

keyDialogue.quote: You got it--?!
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

plotSummary.brief: Eddie encounters his ex-brother-in-law Vernon on the street
plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: (SMUGLY), VERN, EDDIE (CONT'D), (ANNOYED), EDDIE (V.0.), (POINTEDLY), VOICE, VERNON, EDDIE, CONTINUED:, VERNON (CONT'D) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: She was right. I was almost 35. No one talks about "potential" at 35. I had missed the on-ramp. Soon I'd be sleeping in the lower bunk of my childhood bedroom... my father happy to welcome me into the challenging field of dental supply inventory... He's interrupted by A VOICE - calm, amused:
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Eddie. Morgan. VERNON GANT looks him over with condescending bemusment. He's 30, wears an expensive suit, looks like he comes from money.
keyDialogue.speaker: VOICE

keyDialogue.quote: Of all the useless relationships better forgotten and put away in mothballs, is there any more useless than... the ex-brother-in- law?
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

keyDialogue.quote: So... how's Melissa?
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: Ah-hah. That's why you agreed to the beer.
keyDialogue.speaker: VERNON

keyDialogue.quote: I'm making conversation, Vern.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: A couple of kids...

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.), FLASH! Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: All the way home she was back on my mind ... Melissa.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: A memory -- Melissa's face as she's talking, laughing.
keyDialogue.speaker: FLASH!

keyDialogue.quote: She'd been so smart. Smarter than anyone around her. And oh, how she loved to provoke people... 14.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

scenes.title: INT. A DOWNTOWN PARTY - PARTY - NIGHT

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: MELISSA, EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: --Oh, please, you think professional women mentor one another? You think there's some mutually supportive empathetic touch-feely network of kindly pie- bakers? --Those bitches hate each other! Quick, who was the worst boss you ever had? A woman, right?! We can't delegate, we can't command -- I mean, there's a reason we're not generals--! The men gasp, shocked and titillated. The women are furious. Melissa smiles to herself --she's trying not to crack up.
keyDialogue.speaker: MELISSA

keyDialogue.quote: I thought, by now, she'd be curing cancer, directing movies, running for the Senate... We HOLD ON MELISSA'S LOVELY, CONFIDENT FACE as her voice fades down and Eddie's fades in.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: What had happened? Her life made no sense. I mean, I could see a direct, plausible link between this Eddie, broke and buzzed at three o'clock in the afternoon, and an earlier Eddie...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

keyDialogue.quote: ... or stealing his dying Aunt's Percocet.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: But there was no link between my Melissa and this upstate Melissa dumped, cold-calling people from her living room.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

Eddie.arc: At rock bottom before discovering NZT

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: 40 long blocks later I was "home." He digs in his pocket for the keys and comes up with... THE LITTLE WHITE PILL
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Well. There was less than nothing to lose. Quickly, impulsively, he swallows it. 16.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (CONT'D), VALERIE, EDDIE (V.0.), EDDIE (V.O.), EDDIE, EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: I didn't want to see anybody. VALERIE, 26 and attractive, emerges, dressed to go out.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Especially not my landlord's nasty young wife. She is immediately soured at the sight of Eddie. Eddie knows what she's thinking.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: Look, enough, okay--?
keyDialogue.speaker: VALERIE

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: ...sitting on the couch of a T.A. I was trying to make, waiting for her to come back out of the bathroom... hoping she'd have a condom...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (CONT'D), VALERIE, EDDIE (V.0.), EDDIE, EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Somehow, my unconscious had served that up... a memory I'd never even recorded. Or was it there the whole time... and all I needed... was the access? ON EDDIE'S FACE - CLOSE As it sinks in:
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Vern was right. This was no recreational drug. Eddie's eyes flick to the laptop in her bag, his manner suddenly intimate, confident.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: If you're writing a paper, that's not the book I'd use.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (CONT'D)

scenes.title: INT. THE DOWNSTAIRS APARTMENT FROM EDDIE'S - NIGHT

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: We'd really worked on her paper, too. In 45 minutes it was a polished gem. She was pleased. We see the laptop set up, books scattered -- then, obviously abandoned for a more pleasurable pursuit.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: One nice little side effect...? I stayed hard for hours. We HEAR female groans of pleasure. Laughter.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.), EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Happy and sore, I returned home. EDDIE'S POV - HIS LIVING ROOM It's the first wide shot we've seen of it, and it hammers home: what a mess. Books scattered across the floor, dirty dishes, broken Venetian blind sashes. The nest of a slob.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: ... But it couldn't be my home, could it? Who would live like this? MONTAGE: Speeded-up shots of Eddie sifting through his books and tapes. Cleaning up the kitchen. The bathroom. Picks up books. He starts moving the sofa. QUICK CUTS: the living room, rapidly whipped into shape. If not stylish, habitable. Final shot: he's sitting on the couch. Thinking.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: What was this drug? I couldn't stay messy on it, I hadn't had a cigarette in six hours... He stares at the pack in his hands. It looks alien.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.), CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: The next morning, I sent a little probe down into my brain. No surge of brilliance came up to greet me. I felt thick and stupid -- a shuffling zombie without my coffee and cigarette. In short...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: CLOSE UP -- EDDIE'S UNDERWEAR is tossed at the hamper - missing it by about a foot. The underwear remain on the floor.
keyDialogue.speaker: CONTINUED:

keyDialogue.quote: I was back.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: But something remained.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: MARK SUTTON, MARK, EDDIE, (SARCASTIC) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: You're kidding.
keyDialogue.speaker: MARK

keyDialogue.quote: Words have appeared on paper.
keyDialogue.speaker: (SARCASTIC)

keyDialogue.quote: Written by you. Eddie knows he's on thin ice.
keyDialogue.speaker: MARK SUTTON

plotSummary.detailed: Scene requires detailed analysis.
Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.
Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.), MARK SUTTON'S VOICE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Eddie... give me a call when you get in... The second message is from Mark too. MARK SUTTON'S VOICE Eddie, I'm 40 pages further in... call me... it's a little grandiose, but I'm still reading... A third message - BEEP! MARK SUTTON'S VOICE Okay, how did you do this? I'd, uh, I'd really like to -- shit, just call me the minute you get in, call. Okay? Okay. Eddie jumps up, gleeful-- he knew it! Then his smile fades. Reality hits.
keyDialogue.speaker: MARK SUTTON'S VOICE

keyDialogue.quote: But how would I finish? It was "enhanced" Eddie who displayed all that brilliance. Not me.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE, VERN'S VOICE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Vern! It's Eddie.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: Bad time, okay--?
keyDialogue.speaker: VERN'S VOICE

keyDialogue.quote: Vern -- last night 90 pages just wrote themselves! I totally chucked the novel I pitched them --I suddenly SAW, Vern, how this whole societal economic class struggle -- and its solution -- didn't have to be futuristic or fictional -- it was actually ACHIEVABLE here, in our lifetime -- and I could just lay it out, like, like a manifesto, or something, like Mein Kampf except not by a crazy racist fuck! Okay, I won't talk any more about this if you let me in. The buzzer buzzes.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: VERN, EDDIE (V.0.), VERNON, EDDIE, VERN (CONT'D) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Well, that was fast.
keyDialogue.speaker: VERN

keyDialogue.quote: Don't ask. Leaving the door open, Vern turns around and motions at Eddie with his left hand to come in. The place is all mismatched antique furniture -- the possessions of someone who collected once, with enthusiasm, but who's letting it all go to hell. Vern sits, keeping his injured arm elevated.
keyDialogue.speaker: VERN

keyDialogue.quote: So, Eddie. I guess you're interested after all.
keyDialogue.speaker: VERN (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: It was amazing how quickly it all slotted back into place...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: ..the dealer-client dynamic......
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: ...the easy sacrificing of dignity for the guaranteed return of a dime bag, or a gram, or in this case a little pill that was going to cost me a month's rent. He arrives at Vernon's door. He takes out the keys Vern gave him, but he doesn't need them. The DOOR is AJAR. 27.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

scenes.title: INT. VERN'S APARTMENT - DAY - EDDIE'S POV

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: VERN'S FACE -CLOSE, EDDIE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: In the center of his forehead is a neat little BULLET HOLE.
keyDialogue.speaker: VERN'S FACE -CLOSE

keyDialogue.quote: is no tough guy, and sweat springs to his brow. He starts shaking... then, seized with horror that they might still be in here, he edges to the bedroom. We hear THE POUNDING OF HIS HEART as he peeks in...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

plotSummary.detailed: Scene requires detailed analysis.
Characters present: EDDIE, EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Yes... I... I need to report a murder. Eddie. Morgan. --Edward J. I won't. He puts down the phone, puts his head in his hands. VARIOUS CUTS OF: Eddie sitting. Shifting his butt in various positions. Holding a BASEBALL BAT he's found --just in case "they" come back.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: It took them forever. And the longer I sat there, the clearer I saw... Vern had known whoever had done this. He'd opened the door. CLOSE ON - EDDIE'S FACE
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: And one guess what they'd been looking for. 28.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Scene requires detailed analysis.
Scene requires detailed analysis.
Characters present: EDDIE, EDDIE (CONT'D), CONTINUED:, COP Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: At least you got your last meal. There are lots of takeout containers around.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: You never did like to cook... Eddie's eye falls on VERN'S STOVE. Unlike the rest of the kitchen area, it's pristine. Unspattered. Eddie jumps up. VERN'S STOVE - CLOSE Eddie opens it. The inside is as clean as the outside. We HEAR SIRENS now -- the cops are finally coming, and Eddie must rush. Eddie pulls out THE BROILER - CLOSE Taped to the inside is A LARGE BROWN PADDED ENVELOPE. Slowly, Eddie pulls out the package, reaches into it. EDDIE'S HANDS - CLOSE He is holding about TWENTY THOUSAND DOLLARS in cash. But that's not all. He reaches in again... there's something else inside... Eddie's hand pulls out a LITTLE BLACK ADDRESS BOOK. But there's still something else.. he reaches in again. And now Eddie's hand pulls out A PLASTIC CONTAINER WITH AN AIR- LOCK SEAL... he pries the seal off... Inside are FIVE HUNDRED OF THE LITTLE WHITE PILLS. Eddie HEARS THE THUD OF APPROACHING FEET, voices. Making a decision, he quickly tucks the envelope into his jacket, jumps down from the chair... JUST AS A COP pushes through the door.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: He sees Eddie, spins, POINTS HIS GUN right at him.
keyDialogue.speaker: CONTINUED:

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: DETECTIVE (CONT'D), DETECTIVE, (INTO PHONE), EDDIE, CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: ... No, ex-wife's brother. I just ran into him on the street and he invited me up to, you know... The Detective looks at him suspiciously.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: Buy some drugs?
keyDialogue.speaker: DETECTIVE

keyDialogue.quote: Wha-- No! Talk! What're you --
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

plotSummary.detailed: Scene requires detailed analysis.

keyDialogue.quote: Eddie. You were there?
keyDialogue.speaker: MELISSA'S VOICE

keyDialogue.quote: I hadn't heard her voice in 10 years.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: Right before. I'd just run into him on the street.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Only then did it occur to me that someone could have followed me from Vern's apartment.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.
Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Probably not. Hopefully not. Worth the risk? Eddie enters, and, casting a surreptitious look around, closes the door behind him.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.
Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Back on MDT, it was obvious what I should do.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: A tablet a day... kept the torpor away. And what I could do with my day... was limitless.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: I now had cultural appetites.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Learned to read music in a week...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE V.0., EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.0.) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Even half-listening to any language, I became fluent... Eddie becomes aware that there's ANOTHER RUNNER --a powerful- looking man, gaining on him, closer behind than makes him comfortable. Eddie flicks a glance over his shoulder.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE V.0.

keyDialogue.quote: The only cloud was the nagging feeling I was being followed. With a surge of effort, Eddie speeds up, sprinting across the street just after the light changes. WHIZZING TRAFFIC cuts the mysterious runner off, stops him from following. He remains, panting, at the light.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Was I? Or did MDT create paranoia?
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: Okay, you take this... you mine. You don't pay, you know what we do? We cut you around the waist, peel your skin, pull it up over your head and tie knot in it. And you don't die from that. You suffocate. He lets the full picture sink in for a moment. Then:
keyDialogue.speaker: GENNADY

keyDialogue.quote: My new friend, Kevin Doyle, showed me how you could leverage two and a half times your cash at a day- trading firm... Eddie alone in a stall. He takes TWO MDT TABLETS out of his wallet, downs them.

keyDialogue.quote: I'd been upping the dose for over a week. It seemed to cut my learning curve. OVERLAPPING DISSOLVES of Eddie working at a furious pace. Another trader stands behind Eddie, watching. Second shot: three traders are watching. Third shot: nine traders are watching him, awed.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: It was instinct. But informed instinct -- instinct based on huge amounts of research, which, thanks to MDT, was conducted more rapidly and comprehensively than anyone at Lafayette Day Trading would ever know...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: I don't know who you are, Eddie, or what your game is, but I'm sure of one thing: you don't work in this business. keyDialogue.quote: There are moments in life, moments when you know you've crossed a bridge, your old life is over. Van Loon was my bridge. One week, two weeks from now, I would be hobnobbing with ambassadors, flying to Dubai for meetings, blowing off supermodels, vacationing in Medici villas... And that too, was only a bridge... He steps off the curb.

keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.O.)

keyDialogue.quote: In the end, my stupidity saved me. Eddie, panicked, not looking, runs for the crosswalk. EDDIE'S POV - A HUGE TRUCK is barrelling, unstoppably, right towards him--!

keyDialogue.quote: EDDIE is frozen. The TRUCK SWERVES, up on the curb. Tan Coat must dive out of the way, knocking down pedestrians like bowling pins, as the TRUCK hits a STREETLIGHT, mangling it -- then is WHACKED -- twice -- by TWO CABS piling up behind it. When Tan Coat extracts himself from the pile of prone pedestrians, his last glimpse is of- EDDIE - DOWN THE BLOCK disappearing down into a Subway entrance. Swallowed by a crowd.

keyDialogue.quote: hesitates, but knows that he can't catch up. Eddie's given him the slip. This time.

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (CONT'D), (BEAT), MELISSA (CONT'D), MELISSA, FEMALE VOICE (O.S.), EDDIE (V.0.), EDDIE, EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: What was I dealing with? Who could tell me? I hoped against hope... that Melissa would show. EDDIE'S POV - SCANNING THE PLACE Not one person in it could possibly be Melissa. Eddie sighs. Turns to go.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: Eddie...? Eddie turns back. There, sitting at a booth, is a thick- waisted, short-haired brunette middle-aged woman, wearing a large, shapeless sweater. Eddie had looked right at her... and not recognized her. She bears no relationship to the siren Melissa of his memories. Eddie tries to hide the shock on his face.
keyDialogue.speaker: FEMALE VOICE (O.S.)

keyDialogue.quote: Melissa...? He goes to her, sits. Yes, it's the same person, but dramatically, tragically changed. Her face is puffy, her pallor blotchy. There are lines under her eyes and around her mouth, lines brought on by more than the passage of a few years. Eddie tries to conceal his shock.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: You have some left? Good. Go home and take it. Take the dose down, but don't just stop -- you'll die if you just stop. Try to taper off. Otherwise, the headache's just the beginning... I have to go-- Eddie, indeed, is rubbing his temples.

keyDialogue.quote: There is absolutely no truth to the rumor of this merger. None whatsoever. My husband is having some tests, this is a difficult time, and I would appreciate your directing further questions to our attorney... She motions at the gentleman next to her. --Who is also Eddie's attorney, MORRIS BRANDT. The one who was so helpful with the police. The one who held his jacket. Bitter amusement in Eddie's eyes. At least he knows. The APARTMENT BUZZER buzzes. Eddie freezes. Looks at the door. It BUZZES again.
keyDialogue.speaker: MRS. HANK ATWOOD

keyDialogue.quote: It wasn't downstairs security, alerting me to a visitor.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: It was my inner door. Someone was in the building, ten feet away, right now. Eddie walks to his phone, picks it up. Pushes the button, puts it to his ear. It's dead. He pushes the "on" button again and again. Nothing. The buzzer BUZZES again. Eddie rushes to the door, opens the COAT CLOSET. In the closet is a state-of-the-art SECURITY MONITOR. Gennady and TWO MEN are outside his door! Suddenly the MONITOR goes BLACK. Eddie flicks the switch on the monitor. Nothing. Eddie flicks the switch again. It's dead. Someone, somewhere, has figured out how to disarm it. The buzzer BUZZES again. Eddie backs away from the door. We HEAR Eddie's shallow, panicked breathing. He lunges for his briefcase, pulls out his CELL PHONE. THE CELL PHONE - CLOSE It reads "No Signal." BAM! The first slam on the door begins. BAM! The second. The door holds, but Eddie begins to back away in horror.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: I knew they would kill me, slowly and horribly. But this choice would at least be mine. We now hear the ZZZZZZZZ! of some major power tool drilling at the door, punctuated by more BAMS! -- one way or another they're going to get in. Eddie takes a breath, tries to jump. He can't.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: But we're instinctive creatures. We want to live.

keyDialogue.speaker: DRILL:

keyDialogue.quote: pokes, wildly, among the cubes... pushing them aside, revealing at the bottom of the bowl- ONE MDT TABLET looks back up at him. Yes. It's really there! Eddie grabs it, just as, with a splintering CRASH! -- The door goes down. Eddie steps back, brings the pill up to his mouth... But as he steps, he TRIPS on a SOUP CAN he's scattered... he FALLS backwards... his HAND hits the side of the coffee table...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE'S HAND

keyDialogue.quote: The MDT TABLET goes flying... ... as... ...also in slow motion, Gennady and his two thugs smile as they advance into the room... THE MDT TABLET... flies... flies... towards a GRATE in the floor -- a heating vent -- and HITS it... rolling... ... before disappearing forever down the grate. Eddie knows that's it. His life has ended. He sucks in his last breath -- then, with a YELL, he rushes back for the terrace... for his suicide leap... Thug #1 is quicker. Gets to the door first. Eddie will not have the luck to be able to jump. He's trapped between the two Thugs.

Characters present: ON EDDIE, GENNADY, ON EDDIE'S EYES, WHAT--, GENNADY (CONT'D), EDDIE (V.O.), EDDIE (V.0.) (CONT'D), CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: This is a waste of my time, you know that? I am getting out of this part of the business... starting import-export company. Very exciting stuff. A lot on my plate. I need to learn to delegate... Eddie is backed up against a table, which is covered with stuff he's scattered, which includes a BUTCHER BLOCK with A KNIFE in it... Gennady starts arranging his instruments.
keyDialogue.speaker: GENNADY

keyDialogue.quote: First, I will cut skin from you, flay you... you stay alive nice long time... then maybe we cut meat from you, steaks... or maybe softer parts... I get inspiration... He looks up, smiles, to see the effect his words have on Eddie.
keyDialogue.speaker: GENNADY (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: Staring back at Gennady, hard, a fuck-you stare. We can't see behind Eddie's back, but we can see the butcher block, and the knife is gone.
keyDialogue.speaker: ON EDDIE

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: CONTINUED: Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: And its middle finger has been arranged in a vehement fuck- you. The thugs are not amused.
keyDialogue.speaker: CONTINUED:

keyDialogue.quote: look up at a NOISE. Just in time to see Eddie bolting out the front door of the apartment.
keyDialogue.speaker: THE THUGS

keyDialogue.quote: Later, it would be noted that my neighbor was in the music business. One of his drug deals had obviously gone bad...
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (V.0.)

keyDialogue.quote: And the night was still young.
keyDialogue.speaker: (BEAT)

plotSummary.detailed: Scene requires detailed analysis.
Characters present: EDDIE, (A BEAT) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: I'm sure you're curious about what's happened to your boss. I certainly am. If my attorney was really working for Mr. Atwood, to save his life, then why is he dead? At what point was the Pony Express supposed to ride in with the life- saving medication?
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: Or, did the Pony decide that he should be running his own Pony show? Minus the dog. Tan Coat stares at him, his face without expression.
keyDialogue.speaker: (A BEAT)

scenes.title: INT. A POLITICAL CAMPAIGN OFFICE - DAY

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: REUBEN, EDDIE, REUBEN (CONT'D) Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: ...actually, no, there's no more tickets. --Yeah, I know, an overbooked fundraiser -- there's a first -- well, here he comes, I'll ask him -- Edward!! We see Eddie striding down the corridor, wearing a sharp suit, looking more dignified than we've ever seen him, more adult. The snap and crackle of something new -- power -- is in his step. TWO MALE AIDES flank him. Reuben approaches, falls into step with them.
keyDialogue.speaker: REUBEN

keyDialogue.quote: I think we're looking at a second, overflow event-- there's a wave of donations coming in -- and I don't think they're even going to try a second debate -- don't go yet --
keyDialogue.speaker: REUBEN (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: I have a lunch. They have arrived at Eddie's office. Reuben nods at the closed door.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

scenes.title: INT. A LARGE, CASUAL OFFICE - DAY

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: (A BEAT), EDDIE (CONT'D), (BEAT), STEADMAN (CONT'D), STEADMAN, EDDIE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: Mr. Morgan.
keyDialogue.speaker: STEADMAN

keyDialogue.quote: Nice to see you. He shakes Steadman's hand, but Steadman doesn't get up. Odd. In fact Steadman looks uncommonly relaxed, almost slouched in his chair, looking up at Eddie with a subtle gleam in his eye that Eddie doesn't recognize.
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE

keyDialogue.quote: We appreciate everything you've done for us--
keyDialogue.speaker: EDDIE (CONT'D)

plotSummary.detailed: Characters present: EDDIE (CONT'D), THE END, (CORDIAL), STEADMAN (CONT'D), STEADMAN, EDDIE Extended scene with significant action and dialogue.

keyDialogue.quote: It's not so bad, is it? Eddie doesn't answer.
keyDialogue.speaker: STEADMAN

keyDialogue.quote: Doesn't every man on the path to greatness have to tolerate the wind- drag of compromise? A black LIMO waits at the curb.
keyDialogue.speaker: STEADMAN (CONT'D)

keyDialogue.quote: Overall, we'll all be better off... foreign policy, the courts, even the Constitution could stand a little tweaking... They descend the last few steps. Steadman opens the limo door for Eddie... But Eddie hesitates. Doesn't get in.
keyDialogue.speaker: STEADMAN (CONT'D)
